properties.name: Schloss
properties.Info: The castle is a building complex in Münster. The building is constructed in a U-shape. In front of the castle there is a forecourt and in the back there is the Münster Botanical Garden. The castle is used as an administrative building by the University

properties.name: Ueberwasserkirche
properties.Info: The Überwasserkirche takes its name from its location: when viewed from St. Paul's Cathedral, you have to cross “water” (the Aa river) to reach the church. The Überwasserkirche is one of the oldest churches, as a predecessor building already existe

properties.name: Domplatz
properties.Info: Domplatz is the open space in front of St. Paul's Cathedral. Until 1916, the Send fair was held there three times a year, after which it moved to Schlossplatz. Today, Domplatz hosts a weekly market on Wednesdays and Fridays, where fresh food and flowers,

properties.name: Dom
properties.Info: St. Paul's Cathedral is the mother church of the Diocese of Münster and was built in the 13th century. The cathedral has a nave and a transept. There are also numerous works of art in the building.

properties.name: Kiepenkerl
properties.Info:
The Kiepenkerl was a small trader who transported everyday goods between the countryside and the city using a “Kiepe” (a basket for the back).
Today, the Kiepenkerl is a traditional figure in Münster and the surrounding area.

properties.name: altes Haus
properties.Info: The Roggenmarkt is located on Prinzipalmarkt and is, together with the Old Fish Market, is one of the oldest markets in Münster. It got its name from the trade in rye. There are many historic merchant houses on Roggenmarkt, most of which were completely

properties.name: Drubbel
properties.Info: The Roggenmarkt is located on Prinzipalmarkt and is, together with the Old Fish Market, is one of the oldest markets in Münster. It got its name from the trade in rye. There are many historic merchant houses on Roggenmarkt, most of which were completely destroyed during World War II. The house in the picture has an original façade, which can be recognized by its elaborate ornamentation and shutters.

properties.name: Lambertikirche
properties.Info: St. Lambert's Church was built in its present form in the 14th and 15th centuries in the late Gothic style. Münster was influenced for several years by the Anabaptists, whose three leaders were executed after regaining power by being hung in cages and l

properties.name: Historisches Rathaus
properties.Info: The historic town hall is located on Prinzipalmarkt and gained particular fame through the negotiations for the Peace of Westphalia in Münster and Osnabrück, which ended the Thirty Years' War in Europe in 1648. The building was also destroyed during Wo

properties.name: Salzstraße
properties.Info: Salzstraße is the oldest trade route in Münster and is now a pedestrian zone. A special feature are the brass-edged stones from all Hanseatic cities, which were embedded in the ground in 1993. How many can you spot?

properties.name: Erbdrostenhof
properties.Info: The Erbdrostenhof was built between 1753 and 1757 and designed by Johann Conrad Schlaun, the same architect who designed the castle. It is a Baroque aristocratic palace and was intended for the former highest-ranking officials of the city of Münster. To

properties.name: Stadtmuseum
properties.Info: The City Museum was founded in 1979 and opened in 1982 with an exhibition on the Anabaptists. It moved to its current building in 1989. It showcases the history of the city of Münster and also hosts temporary exhibitions.

properties.name: Synagoge
properties.Info: The current new synagogue was built in 1961. The old synagogue used to stand on the same site, but it was destroyed during Kristallnacht in 1938.

properties.name: Botanischer Garten
properties.Info: The botanical was founded in 1803 for research and teaching. Furthermore, it’s important for diversity and preserving of species. People in Münster are using the Botanical garden for relaxation and silence. Sometimes there are also guided tours.

properties.name: Cafe fam
properties.Info: Café fam is a bar and café since 2018. It’s a place to have breakfast, lunch or a cozy coffee with home-made bread and cake.

properties.name: La tienda
properties.Info: La tienda is an association founded in 1993 which lives by the honorary engagement from people. The important thing for this association are: selling fair-trade products, education work and public work. The profits are invested in education work.

properties.name: Offenes Bücherregal
properties.Info:
It’s a public book shelf for everyone. You can take one book but you have to put one other book in there.
It’s a nice possibility to read and learn something new and to exchange books.

properties.name: Gruen&Form
properties.Info: The store was founded in 1994 and has products which are mainly from Italy, France and Portugal but also from Tunisia.

properties.name: sFachl
properties.Info:
A cute store who sells products from differents artist and seller. Unique about this store is that every artist has a corner for his products.
Available products are accessoires, food, alcohol, household items and decoration.

properties.name: gruene wiese
properties.Info: It’s mainly a retail store but for clothes fair-trade and made of good fabric.

properties.name: Teehaus Tropic
properties.Info: A little shop where mainly tea and tea utensils are sold. Additionally, you can find japanese kitchen products there.

properties.name: Kauf Dich Gluecklich
properties.Info: A shop with clothes, decoration and accessoires from which some are vegan, hand-made or fair produced.

properties.name: Homebeis
properties.Info: A shop with local products: drinks, alcohol, decoration, Münster souvenirs, papeterie and snacks. Friendly and courteous advice on products and gifts.

properties.name: SuperBioMarkt
properties.Info: A bio supermarket in the basement of the Arkaden. Useful and nice for a little snack while being in the city.

properties.name: AFAUN
properties.Info: A similar retail store for clothes to „gruene wiese“ with clothes made of good fabric and high quality.

properties.name: Krawummel
properties.Info: A vegan restaurant with nice and tasty food as well as friendly staff.

properties.name: Aaseekugeln
properties.Info: The „giant pool balls“ were a sculpture project by Claes Oldenburg from 1977. Originally, they are white but artists or random people always paint the balls. It’s a recurring thing that they are painted and they are painted white by a painting comp

properties.name: Graffiti e-motion
properties.Info: Münster is and will always be a cycling city! The e-motion store's façade features a bicycle motif.

properties.name: 100 Arme der Guan-yin
properties.Info: For his sculpture in Münster, Huang Yong Ping drew inspiration from both Duchamp's iconic work, the Bottle Rack (1914), and the Christ figure in St. Ludgeri Church, which lost its arms in a World War II bombing. Instead of bottles, the six-meter-high Bo

properties.name: Glockenspiel
properties.Info: Six carillons are scattered throughout the city center, attracting the attention of pedestrians throughout the day. They can be heard at various times while wandering through the city. There are musical elements daily at 12pm, 4pm, 5pm and 6pm.

properties.name: Otto Freundlich
properties.Info: Near the synagogue stands a sculpture by the artist, Jew and communist Otto Freundlich, who was born in 1878. He was murdered in 1943 in a Nazi concentration camp.

properties.name: Graffiti Baeckerei Schrunz
properties.Info: Cosy with coffee and cake. The Schrunz bakery has had a wall design added to its seating area.

properties.name: Graffiti Affenkaesten
properties.Info: A series of five electrical boxes that have been transformed into monkeys.

properties.name: Graffiti Hafenwelle
properties.Info: The wave is located directly on the harbour promenade. The façade belongs to the Powersports fitness studio.

properties.name: Graffiti Kulti Kebab
properties.Info: The interior design at Kulti Kebab is based on the theme of Berlin and graffiti.

properties.name: Graffiti Mexikanische Wrestler
properties.Info: Masked Mexican wrestlers battle with their eyes on this wall.

properties.name: Graffiti VW Bulli
properties.Info: The illusion painting provides a glimpse into the garage, where an old VW Bulli is parked.

properties.name: Graffiti Totenkopfaeffchen
properties.Info: Three cute little monkeys who live on the outskirts of Münster.

properties.name: Sanctuarium
properties.Info: A sanctuary is a sacred, protected place, like a church or a temple. The Münster sanctuary consists of a circular brick wall with no entrance to its interior. Especially in summer, this is a wonderful place to spend time and chill out.

properties.name: Diözesanbibliothek
properties.Info:
The new building of the diocesan library in the centre of Münster, designed by architect Max Dudler and opened in December 2005, is an approximately 70-metre-long box-shaped structure reminiscent of an oversized bookshelf.

The library is separated from

properties.name: LWL-Museum
properties.Info: The museum displays works of art from the early Middle Ages to the present day. It has a collection of more than 300,000 exhibits. The historical holdings include works of art from the region and neighboring areas. Visitors to the museum can also admire

properties.name: Aegidiimarkt
properties.Info: In the post-war period, this site was used as a parking lot for a long time. It was only after an architectural competition that a modern business, office, and residential center was built in 1976. A protective bunker was also built, which can shelter 3,

properties.name: Muenster Arkaden
properties.Info: The six connected buildings together make a group that creates a public connection between the busy Rothenburg and the pedestrian zone in Ludgeristraße by means of a big three- to four-story passageway. Here, you can shop in a wide variety of stores or

properties.name: Stubengasse
properties.Info: Stubengasse has been known in Münster since the Middle Ages. The name comes from the bathhouses that stood here in the Middle Ages and were still located here after 1610. Today, the square is a venue for street performers, a meeting place for demonstrat

properties.name: Clemenskirche
properties.Info: Clemenskirche is a Baroque monastery and hospital church built between 1745 and 1753 for the Brothers of Mercy according to plans by Johann Conrad Schlaun. The monastery was dissolved in 1811.

properties.name: Stadtbuecherei
properties.Info: The city library building was constructed between 1991 and 1993. Particularly impressive is the alleyway that runs through the middle of the building, offering exciting insights. A sculpture at the end of the passageway reflects the openness of the archi

properties.name: Stadttheater
properties.Info: Theater Münster opened on February 4, 1956, as the first major new theater building in post-war Germany and is internationally regarded as an important example of modern architecture. Its roots date back to 1774, when Franz Freiherr von Fürstenberg had

properties.name: Zwinger
properties.Info: The Zwinger in Münster was built in the early 16th century as a defensive tower and gun tower for the city's defense. In its approximately 500-year history, it has served many functions, including as a defensive tower, mill, powder magazine, prison, stu

properties.name: Schlosstheater
properties.Info: The cinema “Schloßtheater” was built in 1953 and is a listed heritage building. It is home to Germany’s first film club. It was renovated in 1995 in the style of 1920s theaters. Today, the cinema focuses on European arthouse films and hosts special events and festivals.

properties.name: Heilig Kreuz Kirche
properties.Info: Located in the heart of the Kreuzviertel is the “Kreuzkirche” built between 1899 and 1902. Interesting is the installation with the words “Ja, ich bin da” on the four sides of the tower which means “Yes, I am here”.

properties.name: Raesfeldstraße (1)
properties.Info: The Raesfeldstraße is one of the central streets in the Kreuzviertel. It got its name from prince-bishop Raesfeld who reigned from 1557 to 1566. The street is characterized by some listed heritage buildings from the late 19th and the early 20th century.

properties.name: Raesfeldstraße (80)
properties.Info: The Raesfeldstraße is one of the central streets in the Kreuzviertel. It got its name from prince-bishop Raesfeld who reigned from 1557 to 1566. The street is characterized by some listed heritage buildings from the late 19th and the early 20th century. On the higher numbers you can find a mix of higher story buildings as well as one-family homes.

properties.name: Schulstraße
properties.Info: One of the streets in the “Kreuzviertel”. In spring time the cherry trees are blossoming in pink and creating a beautiful photo spot in combination with the architecture.

properties.name: Studtstraße
properties.Info: The Studtstraße is a street in the Kreuzviertel which was named after Dr. Conrad von Studt who was a honorary citizen from the city of Münster and was supreme president and minister of education of Westphalia in the late 19th century.

properties.name: Lazarettstraße
properties.Info: It was named in 1875 after the “Standortlazarett” (military hospital), which was already located at Neutor at that time. The street runs north around what was then the hospital complex. Today, the buildings belong to the German-Netherlands Corps.

properties.name: Kleimannstraße
properties.Info: The Kleimannstraße runs parallel to the promenade along a green meadow that often serves as a dog playground. The street was named in 1900 after city councilor Adolf Kleimann (*1825 - †1911), who, among other things, built the Kreuzschanze as part of

properties.name: Roestbar
properties.Info: The Roestbar in the Kreuzviertel is a popular café. In summer, you can sit outside, watch the hustle and bustle of the city, and enjoy a delicious coffee with a slice of cake.

properties.name: Buddenturm
properties.Info: The Buddenturm is the oldest surviving part of the former city fortifications. It was built in the 12th century and used as a defensive tower. In 1533, it served as a prison and from 1598 onwards it was used as a powder tower. The name Buddenturm comes f

properties.name: Antiquariat Wilsberg
properties.Info: The „Antiquariat Solder“ is a normal antique store in Münster. But a few times a year there are camera people and they are filming new episode of the series in german TV.

properties.name: Rewe Kreuztor
properties.Info: The 7:1 win of Germany vs. Brazil in the half final game of the world cup 2014 was beyond all beliefs. But even more unbelievable is guy in Münster who predicted this exact result, in front of this supermarket.

properties.name: Ludgerikreisel
properties.Info: In a local TV program was a short video about bicycle controls in the city of Münster, especially the forbidden riding of a bike on a zebra cross. Especially a guy who discussed his behaviour and even comes back with his laptop and some researches, to p

properties.name: Tatortszene (2)
properties.Info: For the 2019 episode “Väterchen Frost” (Fatherly Frost), the Tatort actors were allowed to film at the Christmas market at Lambertikirche.

properties.name: Tartortszene (3)
properties.Info: A recurring scene in the „Tatort Münster“. When they are producing a new „Tatort“ this place is often closed for minutes or hours due to filming scenes.

properties.name: Bares fuer Rares
properties.Info: In the popular german TV show „Bares für Rares“ there are dealers who are buying antiques from common german people. One of them, Daniel Meyer, has an antique store of his own in near the „Altstadt“ of Münster.

properties.name: Matcha-See
properties.Info: In 2024, a pond near the promenade got popular for being green like a Matcha-drink. It was called „Matcha lake“ and even got listed as a rightful site of Münster for some time.

properties.name: Tretboot Schwan
properties.Info: In the time around 2006 a black swan appears at the Aasee in Münster. The story got popular as the swan was always by the side of a pedal boat which was formed as a big white swan. The love story lasted for some years but then the black swan, Petra, dis

properties.name: Tuckesburg
properties.Info: The Tuckesburg is a residential building built in the 19th century. A building beautiful, interesting and eerie at the same time.

properties.name: Picassoplatz
properties.Info: At first glance, this place seems like a normal space between buildings in the city. But at second glance, the square is paved in red and grey which form the portrait of Pablo Picasso.

properties.name: Himmelsleiter
properties.Info: The „Himmelsleiter“ was installed in 2022 until spring 2024, at again in fall 2024. It’s not a hidden gem at first glance because it’s really obvious and easy to spot. The special thing ist he ladder continues to shine inside if you take a closer

properties.name: Dominikanerkirche
properties.Info: The „Foucaultsche Pendel“ is an artwork by Gerhard Richter installed in 2018. It’s brings science and comtemporary art together and creates a special feeling inside the church.

properties.name: Fluss Aa
properties.Info: The Aa, the little river floating through Münster, is sometimes hidden. If you start at Münzstraße (near Café Extrablatt, Münzstraße/ Tibusstraße) you can walk until the Aegidiimarkt and enjoy the silence and green area in the middle of the city.

properties.name: Cafe 1648
properties.Info: Although located in the city center of Münster, the Café 1648 is easy to miss because it’s on the 11th floor of the Stadthaus. The view over the city is unique and a real hidden gem.

properties.name: Tatortszene (1)
properties.Info: The promenade was first used as a filming location for the TV crime series Tatort in 2007, in the episode “Satisfaktion.” In it, the character Frank Thiel rides his bicycle along the promenade.

properties.name: Prinzipalmarkt
properties.Info: Prinzipalmarkt is an old bourgeois market street that has existed since around the 12th century. It has been called Prinzipalmarkt since 1611. Most of the houses were destroyed during World War II and then rebuilt in their original style. Today, Prinzipa

properties.name: Theater Klo
properties.Info: If you stand in the right place outside the theatre, you might notice that it looks like a toilet.

properties.name: Theater alte Mauer
properties.Info: The Romberger Hof was a classicist aristocratic palace. It was a prestigious building in the city and housed, among other things, a theater and a music academy. The ruins stand together with a large old tree that survived the bombing war in the courtyard

properties.name: Graffiti Kreuzkirche
properties.Info: The main attraction is the Heilige Kreuz Kirche in the center of the Kreuzviertel district. Not far from it are electrical boxes depicting an illustration of this church.

properties.name: Graffiti Eichhörnchen
properties.Info: In the Kreuzviertel district, not far from the promenade, there is a small playground with a small bouldering wall guarded by a cute squirrel.

properties.name: Platz des Westfaelischen Friedens
properties.Info: The place was named „Platz des Westfälischen Friedens“ in 1998, 350 years after the end of the Thirty Years‘ War in 1648. It is located behind the historical town hall.

properties.name: Schlossplatz
properties.Info: This place became a formal square in 1759 under the name “Neuplatz”. In 1927 it was renamed in “Hindenburgplatz” until 2012 where it was named “Schlossplatz”. Over the centuries, the place has mainly served as a large open space for parades and events. If there are no events, it is used as a parking space.

properties.name: Kardinal von Galen
properties.Info: Clemens August Graf von Galen was a German Catholic Bishop of Münster and later Cardinal who became famous for his courageous opposition to Nazi policies. He survived the regime but died in 1946 due to an illness. He was beatified by Pope Benedict XVI..

properties.name: Truemmerlok
properties.Info: The “Trümmerlok” is a reminder of the bomb damage caused during the Second World War, the clearing of rubble and the reconstruction of Münster. The small locomotive was built around 1910 by Orenstein & Koppel in Berlin and was used after the war to remove the masses of rubble.

properties.name: St. Ludgeri
properties.Info: St Ludgeri is one of the oldest churches in Münster. It was built from 1173 in the Romanesque style and is dedicated to St Ludger. The striking tower combines Romanesque and Gothic architectural forms, while the choir windows date from the post-war period.

properties.name: St. Servatii
properties.Info: The St. Servatii is an historic church dating back to 1230. Most parts were destroyed during World War II, and it was rebuilt in 1947. The church combines stylistic elements of late Romanesque and early Gothic architecture

properties.name: St. Petri
properties.Info: St Peter's Church was built between 1590 and 1597 as the church of the Jesuit College. Today it serves as the school church of a high school and is a popular venue for concerts due to its good acoustics.

properties.name: St. Martini
properties.Info: St Martini's is one of the oldest churches in Münster and was built in the 1180s. It was originally a three-aisled basilica, of which only the lowest part of the tower remains today. It is located near the theatre on Martinistraße and is now the first youth church in the diocese of Münster.

properties.name: Bibelmuseum
properties.Info: The Bible Museum which is part of Universität Münster was founded in 1997. It illustrates the history of the Bible with over 1500 exhibits from its manuscript beginnings to the present day.

properties.name: Geomuseum
properties.Info: An interesting and free museum which has expiditions for the history of the earth, its composition and also fossils. This museum contains interactive elements and a nice place to learn something about our earth.

properties.name: Archaeologisches Museum
properties.Info: This museum is located near the cathedral and inside the Fürstenberghaus. The first collection of archaeology goes back to 1883 but it was destroyed in the war. Since 1958 the museum was rebuilt and a new collection was collected.

properties.name: Picassomuseum
properties.Info: This museum was opened in 2000 and houses lithographs and other holdings in various artistic techniques from different creative periods of Pablo Picasso. There are over 800 exhibits.

properties.name: Stadthausturm
properties.Info: The Stadthausturm was built between 1902 and 1907 as tower for the city administration. Although nearly the whole street of Prinzipalmarkt was demolished in World War II, the tower stayed. In 2024 there is a bar called Prinzi-bar.

properties.name: St. Aegidii-Kirche
properties.Info: The church St. Aegidii is located in the city center of Münster. The church was build in 1725. After the end of the Second World War, which the Church survived relatively unscathed, the ceiling painting was temporarily painted over, but was uncovered again in 1983.

properties.name: Geo 1
properties.Info: The Geo1 is one of the university buildings and was built in 2013/2014 and is home to the departments of geography, landscape ecology and geoinformatics.

properties.name: Kapuzinerkloster
properties.Info: The Kapuzinerkloster was opened in 1862. It has been further extended and modernised in recent decades. A perimeter path leads through the monastery garden directly along the high outer wall. The landscaped area includes a statue of the Virgin Mary, which is placed in the centre of a path roundel, and a large cross with a corpus on a hill.

properties.name: Buecherverbrennung
properties.Info: Memorial for the book burning from the Nazi regime which remembers this „cultural barbarism“.

properties.name: Dreizehner-Denkmal
properties.Info: The memorial was erected in 1925 and commemorates the soldiers of the 13th Infantry Regiment who died in World War I and later also World War II. Its martial symbolism reflects a traditional, uncritical form of remembrance that glorifies military sacrifice rather than addressing the suffering caused by war.

properties.name: Hüfferstiftung
properties.Info: The building is from the late 19th century. Today it is used as a foundation, founded by Wilhelm Hüffer who was a merchant and benefactor. His father, Johann Hermann Hüffer, was also prominent because he was the mayor of Münster from 1842 to 1848.

properties.name: Eingang alter Zoo
properties.Info: This was the entrance of the Old zoo. The Old Zoo of Münster was founded in the late 19th century by the zoologist and priest Hermann Landois. It was located near the Aa River and became a popular destination for education and leisure, combining zoology, architecture, and public entertainment. After World War II, the zoo was gradually relocated, and the original site was later redeveloped. Today, the area is a park-like landscape that still preserves memories of its former use.

properties.name: Eulenhaus
properties.Info: The Owl House is one of the very few remaining structures of Münster’s Old Zoo. It once served as a shelter for owls and other birds of prey and reflects the zoo’s early approach to animal exhibition. While most zoo buildings disappeared over time, the Owl House survived. Today, it stands as a reminder of the historical zoo.

properties.name: Observantenkirche
properties.Info: The Observantenkirche was the monastery church of the Franciscan Observants until 1811. Today it is the Protestant University and Concert Church of the University of Münster. After being destroyed in the Second World War, it was simply rebuilt and is mainly used for church services and concerts.

properties.name: Bischoefliches Palais
properties.Info: The Bischöfliche Palais is the residence of the Bishop of Münster and the seat of the General Vicariate. It was built in 1732, badly destroyed in the Second World War and then rebuilt in a simplified form. Today it is a central building of the diocese of Münster.

properties.name: Ueberwasserhof
properties.Info: Since August 2021, the former Hotel Überwasserhof has offered students the opportunity to live in one of the 59 apartments. The residential units are spread over three floors with different sizes and price categories.

properties.name: Pinkus Müller
properties.Info: The Pinkus Müller is a brewery since 1866 in the historical “Kuhviertel” (cow district). It is the only remaining brewery and malt house in this city out of more than 150 former breweries. Beers from the brewery are sold worldwide. Why not try some beer from the vending machine outside the building?

properties.name: Kultur Kneipe
properties.Info: The building is from the early 20th century and it was planned to demolish in 1973. But it was occupied and saved from demolition. Additionally it was one of the first house occupation in postwar Germany. Today it is used as restaurant with occasional cultural events.

properties.name: Davidwache
properties.Info: The Davidwache is a bar named after the legendary police station in Hamburg. This bar is the beginning of the Jüdefelderstraße which is a popular party street in Münster, especially on Wednesdays and Fridays.

properties.name: Fuerstenbergdenkmal
properties.Info: Franz von Fürstenberg was born in Arnsberg in 1729. He was a prominent politician during the second half of the 18th century. He introduced reforms to the school system, for example making education compulsory.

properties.name: ULB
properties.Info: This red lettering is installed at the glass façade of the library of the university. It is placed there since the 2009 renovations, and it was created by Babak Saed. His intention is to remind of the critic use of information. Interesting is also its placement on the corner so its not possible to see it easily. There is always a “break”.

properties.name: 3D Schloss
properties.Info: This relief map near the castle shows a map of the inner city of Münster inside the former city walls which are now the promenade.

properties.name: Glasboot an der Hand
properties.Info: In between university buildings this art can be found. It is installed temporally and lasts only until 2026. This hand holds a broken boat made of glass and is a reminder for migration.

properties.name: Graffiti Lilie
properties.Info: This art is graffiti placed on a power box between a big street and a green area.

properties.name: Große Wiese
properties.Info: A nice green area between a high traffic street and the promenade. Part of a little river is also seen here. This green area is often used for parties in freshmen week.

properties.name: Goldene Bruecke
properties.Info: The “golden bridge” is a bridge located at the mouth of the Aa river into the Aasee.

properties.name: Abluftplastik
properties.Info: This sculpture is made by Friedrich Gläsel in 1971 and shows exhaust pipes. This art is located near the building of LBS Bausparkasse and if you take a closer look you can find more than one on the property!

properties.name: Herkules-Skulptur
properties.Info: This statue made of bronze is placed in the park between the building of LBS-Bausparkasse and Aasee. It is made by Bernhard Kleinhans in 1973. It shows Hercules and other mythological creatures.

properties.name: LBS-Bausparkasse
properties.Info: The LBS-Bausparkasse is a “building society” and is located in this interesting architectural building which looks outdated and futuristic at the same time. It was build in 1975. By the bronze looking windows it looks peaceful but if you take a closer look you can see people working there!

properties.name: Marienfigur
properties.Info: This statue shows a Madonna which exists since 1976 and was renovated 2013. Around the Madonna is a fountain and an iron fence.

properties.name: Large Vertebrae Bronze
properties.Info: This bronze art is between the building of the LBS-Bausparkasse and the Aasee and placed on a green area. The sculpture was created by Henry Moore around 1968.

properties.name: Reliefkarte vom Universitaetsgelaende
properties.Info: This relief map shows the layout of the university site. It’s possible to see and feel the different buildings and places plus some additional information.

properties.name: Blaues Haus
properties.Info: This is a bar in the Kuhstraße, a popular street with several bars. It is easy recognizable by its blue color which causes the name: „blaues Haus“ in englisch: blue house. It was opened in 1970.

properties.name: Torhaus
properties.Info: Built in 1778 the two houses were partly used as sentry and also used as customs in history. Nowadays, one of the two little houses is used as a gallery and the other opened as a café in 2025.

properties.name: Kunst beim Buddenturm
properties.Info: Two larger-than-life bronze figures and three white patinated aluminium figures are grouped around a basin in an exciting yet informal ensemble. This meadow is a wonderful place to relax and listen to the lapping of the water, especially in summer.

properties.name: Graffiti Zwinger
properties.Info: This graffiti shows the Zwinger which is an old building near the promenade.

properties.name: Lotharinger Kloster
properties.Info: The Lotharinger Chorfrauenkirche is a baroque church in Münster, which was built around 1764 by Johann Conrad Schlaun. Today it is used as a branch of the registry office for weddings, and you can occasionally see bridal couples in front of the building.

properties.name: Adlerstatue
properties.Info: The eagle memorial on Hörsterplatz was built in 1930 and honours the fallen soldiers of the Royal Prussian 4th Lorraine Field Artillery Regiment No. 70 in the First World War. The eagle standing on a destroyed cannon symbolises battle, loyalty and military tradition.

properties.name: Siegesdenkmal
properties.Info: The war memorial at Mauritztor was inaugurated in 1909 and is a memorial to the fallen Münster soldiers of the unification wars of 1864, 1866 and 1870/71. It was conceived as a monumental memorial to the victors and was intended to express unity, patriotism and national cohesion.

properties.name: Gesicht von Johann Conrad Schlaun
properties.Info: On a high school this face is painted at the outer walls of the building. The face shows Dr. Johann Conrad Schlaun who gives this school its name. Johan Conrad Schlaun was the prince-bishops master builder and created many buildings in the city e.g. the Schloss in Münster, the Erbdrostenhof or many churches. If you turn around you can also find a restaurant called “Johann Conrad”.

properties.name: Schmetterling
properties.Info: On one of the walls of the Schlaun Gymnasium, a high school, there is this butterfly painted in colors.

properties.name: Regenbogenweg
properties.Info: Between the cinema Cineplex and the begin of the harbor quay you can find this line painted in rainbow colors. It crosses the open space diagonal and often used by cyclists.

properties.name: Hafenkai
properties.Info: The harbor quay is characterized by modern buildings from the renovation of the harbor a few years ago. But what you can also find are old and renovated harbor buildings. The space is used for offices, restaurants, bars and art rooms as well as a recreation space with walking paths and seating areas.

properties.name: Graffiti Cafe Unique
properties.Info: The façade of Café Unique has recently been decorated with beautiful graffiti. However, the café is unfortunately permanently closed.

properties.name: Graffiti Haus der Wohnunglosenhilfe
properties.Info: This graffiti art on a garage door near the main station shows a boy looking at popular building and places in Münster, e.g. the cathedral and the Prinzipalmarkt.

properties.name: Graffiti Ulus Atelier
properties.Info: You can admire a graffiti of beautiful butterflies and flowers on the wall of the Ulu tailor's shop.

properties.name: Blumenschrift
properties.Info: On this place you can see the letters of “MÜNSTER FRIEDEN” in the grass which means “Münster peace”. In spring and summer time the letters are planted with flowers.

properties.name: Neuapostolische Kirche
properties.Info: The Neuapostolische Kirche is not catholic or protestant although it’s a Christian church.

properties.name: Berufskolleg Adolph-Kolping
properties.Info: This vocational college offers professional education. The building remembers of the architecture von Johann Conrad Schlaun who designed many other building of the city because he was the master builder of the prince-bishop

properties.name: Universitaetsgebaeude Bispinghof
properties.Info: The Bispinghof was one of the four original farms that gave rise to the city of Münster and served to supply the cathedral castle in the Middle Ages. It later lost its importance and became the property of the city. Today, many language courses from the university are held here.

properties.name: Amtsgericht
properties.Info: The Amtsgericht building was constructed between 1875 and 1879 and is located to the south of Schlossplatz. It was largely destroyed during the war and reconstructed after the war.

properties.name: Astronomische Uhr
properties.Info: The Astronomical Clock in the Münster Cathedral was build between 1540 and 1542 and is a piece of Renaissance science, art and craftsmanship. It displays besides the time also the movements of the sun, moon, planets, and the zodiac according to the geocentric worldview.
